definition:
next to the first in place or time                                      
             
             was second in line

next to the first in value, excellence, or degree                                      
             
             his second choice of schools

inferior, subordinate                                      
             
             was second to none

ranking next below the top of a grade or degree in authority or precedence                                      
             
             second mate

alternate, other                                      
             
             elects a mayor every second year

resembling or suggesting a prototype : another                                      
             
             a second Thoreau
being the forward gear or speed next higher than first in a motor vehicle
relating to or having a part typically subordinate to and lower in pitch than the first part in concerted or ensemble music
one that is number two in a series  — see Table of Numbers

one that is next after the first in rank, position, authority, or precedence                                      
             
             the second in line
one that assists or supports another
the musical interval embracing two diatonic degrees
a tone at this interval
the harmonic combination of two tones a second apart
merchandise that is usually slightly flawed and does not meet the manufacturer's standard for firsts or irregulars
an article of such merchandise
the act or declaration by which a parliamentary motion is seconded
a place next below the first in a competition, examination, or contest
second base
the second forward gear or speed of a motor vehicle
a second helping of food

in the second place : secondly                                      
             
             These two kinds of image … have a powerful appeal for us, first, because we are all … inevitably concerned about our fate, and second, because our concern is itself twofold …

before all others with one exception                                      
             
             the nation's second largest city
the 60th part of a minute of angular measure
the 60th part of a minute of time : 1/86,400 part of the mean solar day
an instant of time : moment
to give support or encouragement to : assist
to support (a fighting person or group) in combat : bring up reinforcements for
to support or assist in contention or debate
to endorse (a motion or a nomination) so that debate or voting may begin
to release (someone, such as a military officer) from a regularly assigned position for temporary duty with another unit or organization
occupying the number two position in a series
next to the first in importance or rank
another of the same kind
in a position that only comes after one other in time, order, or importance
—used to introduce a statement that is the second in a series of statements
to approve (something, such as a motion) during a meeting so that discussion or voting can begin
to agree with (a suggestion or statement)
to move (someone) from a regular job to a different place, department, etc., for a short period of time

being next after the first in time or order                                      
             
             a second child

next lower in rank, value, or importance than the first                                      
             
             second prize

another of the same type                                      
             
             a second car
a 60th part of a minute of time or of a degree

moment sense 1, instant                                      
             
             I'll be with you in a second.
to support a suggestion, motion, or nomination

in the second place or rank                                      
                

            the second tallest mountain

someone or something that is second                                      
             
             Theirs is the first house, and mine is the second.
in: was second in line
his second choice of schools
was second to none
second mate
elects a mayor every second year
a second Thoreau
the second in line
These two kinds of image … have a powerful appeal for us, first, because we are all … inevitably concerned about our fate, and second, because our concern is itself twofold …
the nation's second largest city
They are my second favorite band.
We sat in the second row.
the second house on the left
B is the second letter in the alphabet.
That's the second time I've seen him today.
Chocolate is my first choice; vanilla is my second choice.
The chair needs a second coat of paint.
She plays second violin in the city orchestra.
I would like to second the motion to adjourn.
“Let's call it a day.” “I'll second that.”
a second child
the second floor
second prize
a second car
a second language
I'll be with you in a second.
Theirs is the first house, and mine is the second.

definition: an extremely short period of time that is one of the 60 parts in a minute
an extremely short period of time
a product that is not perfect that you can buy at a reduced price
a second-class university degree
in: She won the 400 metres race in 51 seconds.
Each commercial lasts for 30 seconds.
Just give me a second to put my coat on.
I’ll be with you in two seconds.
seconds later/within seconds  (=almost immediately): The computer crashed seconds later.

definition: immediately after the first and before any others:
the position in which a person finishes a race or competition if they finish immediately behind the winner:
Second is used to show that only one thing is better, bigger, etc. than the thing mentioned:
another:
happening only once out of every two possible times:
after the first and before any others:
used to introduce the second thing in a list of things you want to say or write:
a short unit of time that is equal to a 60th of a minute:
a very short period of time:
as soon as :
the second person or thing to do or be something, or the second person or thing mentioned:
an extra amount of food that is given after the first amount has been eaten:
the smallest unit used for measuring an angle:
a product that is sold cheaply because it is damaged or not in perfect condition
a person who takes care of someone who is fighting in a boxing competition or, in the past, in a duel (= organized fight)
in a vehicle, the gear that combines power with limited speed and is used when increasing or reducing speed:
an undergraduate degree from a university in the UK and some other countries that is a good degree but not the best possible

→ 
        
         second base
to make a formal statement of support for a suggestion made by someone else during a meeting so that there can be a discussion or vote:
to send an employee to work somewhere else temporarily, either to increase the number of workers or to replace other workers, or to exchange experience or skills:
(a person or thing) coming immediately after the first:
any of the 60 parts that a minute is divided into:
A second is also any short period of time:
to make a formal statement of support for a suggestion made by someone else during a meeting in order to allow a discussion or vote:
a product that is sold at a lower price than usual because it is damaged or not in perfect condition:
to send an employee to work somewhere else temporarily, either to increase the number of workers there, to replace another worker, or to exchange experiences or skills:
in: Is Carla her first or second child?
This is the second time I've had flu this winter.
Today is the second (of March).
First prize is two weeks in Barbados and second prize is a weekend in Rome.
Jones took second place in the long jump.
St Petersburg is Russia's second (biggest/largest) city.
Iraq's oil reserves are second only to Saudi Arabia's.
She is often described as a second Marilyn Monroe.
You really should make the most of the opportunity, because you won't get a second chance.
Richard and Liz have a second home in the mountains.
Pay attention to what she's saying because she won't explain it a second time.
We've decided to hold the conference every second year.
Robertson won the race and Cameron was/came/finished second.
In this business, money comes first and principles come a very poor second (= they are much less important).
There are two good reasons why we can't do it. First, we can't afford it, and second, we don't have time.
There are 60 seconds in a minute.
These computers process millions of instructions per second.
The new system can trace a phone call in a fraction of a second.
"Come on, hurry up!" "I'll just/only be a second - I need to close the window."
Do you have a second, Paul? I need to talk to you.
It won't take a second (= it will be very quick).
Wait a couple of/a few seconds before trying again.
The second I saw him, I knew he was going to be a star.
This is the second of the four tests.
Would anyone like seconds of ice cream?
There are 3,600 seconds in a degree.
You'll have to change (down/up) into second.
The motion was proposed by the club's chairwoman and seconded by the secretary.
"I could use a drink." "I'll second that (= I agree with you)!"
During the dispute, many police officers were seconded from traffic duty to the prison service.
He missed only 2 of 11 shots in the second half.
Rent is due the second of every month.
First, what does it cost? And secondly, who’s it for?
She won by 22 seconds.
I’ll be back in a second.
I second the motion to adjourn.
Many goods in sales are seconds.
She was seconded to our department five months ago.
The motion was proposed by the secretary and seconded by the treasurer.

translated_as@fr: la deuxième personne dans la file
Notre équipe a été deuxième au jeu-concours.
la deuxième/seconde fois nous avons mangé dans ce restaurant
J’ai accepté de faire un discours mais maintenant j’ai des doutes.
Je vais prendre le poisson. A la réflexion
Attendez une seconde / un instant ; je ne suis pas tout à fait prêt.
un magasin qui vend des articles de second choix
Tu y vas en premier et j’irai en second.

definition: The second is the duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the cesium-133 atom (at 0 Kelvin).

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
Filling your plate with food for the second time
The duration of 9,192,631,770 periods of radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the cesium 132.91 atom.
A length of time that is very-under-exaggerated.

(n.) A second helping of something, such as food or blowjobs.

(n.) Products that have a fault, and have had the price adjusted accordingly. Manufacturers seconds.
The amount of time it takes for you to ejaculate.
